page.title: 01Blakesley;A Gazetteer.
page.content: The area consists of two small villages the main one being Blakesley.Here lies most of the services for the community. There is a Primary School for the 4-11 year olds, several farms, an art gallery, a public house, a garage, a bakery, a small post office which combines a general store and bank.There are two churches, a chapel at Wood-End and a parish church in Blakesley.In addition to this, a visiting mobile clinic,library,fish-van and woolcraft van also serve the village. Blakesley is well known locally for its Agricultural Show and the National Soap-Box Grand Prix held each year,as well as being a popular 'hunting' area. There is a wide mix of people in the community from the old established village families to the new 'executive' London commuters.
